item.title: Differences Between ERC721 and ERC1155 Token Standards
item.description: The Ethereum network is home to a variety of different token standards, each with its own unique features and capabilities. Two of the most well-known token standards are ERC721 and ERC1155. While both standards are used to create non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the Ethereum network, they have some key differences that are important to understand. ERC721 ERC721 is a token standard that defines a set of rules for creating and managing non-fungible tokens on the Ethereum network.
